unnormalised: Automotive News: Understanding New Traffic Regulations for a Smoother Ride
normalised: Automotive News: Understanding New Traffic Regulations for a Smoother Ride

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26th – Driving in India is about to get a bit more structured! New traffic regulations are being rolled out nationwide, aiming to improve road safety and reduce congestion, according to sources at IIT Bombay's Transportation Engineering Division.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty sixth – Driving in India is about to get a bit more structured! New traffic regulations are being rolled out nationwide, aiming to improve road safety and reduce congestion, according to sources at I I T Bombay's Transportation Engineering Division.

unnormalised: One key change involves stricter enforcement of lane discipline. Drivers weaving in and out of lanes, a common sight on Indian roads, will now face heftier fines, up to Rs. 2000 for repeat offenders.
normalised: One key change involves stricter enforcement of lane discipline. Drivers weaving in and out of lanes, a common sight on Indian roads, will now face heftier fines, up to rupee two thousand for repeat offenders.

unnormalised: The permissible speed limit on expressways like the Mumbai-Pune Expressway remains at 120 km/hr, but stricter speed monitoring systems are being implemented, particularly in accident-prone zones.
normalised: The permissible speed limit on expressways like the Mumbai-Pune Expressway remains at one hundred and twenty kilometer per hour, but stricter speed monitoring systems are being implemented, particularly in accident-prone zones.

unnormalised: Furthermore, regulations regarding vehicle modifications are being tightened. Any unauthorized alterations that compromise safety will result in penalties. Remember the iconic cars from "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge"? While those were cool on screen, mimicking such modifications without proper authorization can now land you in trouble.
normalised: Furthermore, regulations regarding vehicle modifications are being tightened. Any unauthorized alterations that compromise safety will result in penalties. Remember the iconic cars from "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge"? While those were cool on screen, mimicking such modifications without proper authorization can now land you in trouble.

unnormalised: These changes are designed to create a safer and more efficient driving environment for everyone. Familiarize yourself with the updated rules to avoid unwanted challans and contribute to a smoother, more predictable flow of traffic on Indian roads.
normalised: These changes are designed to create a safer and more efficient driving environment for everyone. Familiarize yourself with the updated rules to avoid unwanted challans and contribute to a smoother, more predictable flow of traffic on Indian roads.
